timeline.bodyText: Could we write the improvement proposal?
timeline.author: ajlopezrsk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -55,7 +55,9 @@
     RSKIP172("rskip172"),
     RSKIP174("rskip174"),
     RSKIP180("rskip180"),
-    RSKIPUMM("rskipUMM");
+    RSKIPUMM("rskipUMM"),
+    // TODO: change activation code RSKIPNEW.
+    RSKIPNEW("rskipNEW"); //Handle error in Precompile Contracts execution.

timeline.bodyText: Why not to process these exceptions in TWO catch? And instead of PrecompiledContractException catch ExecutionException or something similar. So we could manage RuntimeException ONLY when the fork is NOT yet activated. Maybe you consider the case as out of scope, but it could be nice to have the RuntimeException removed from execution.
timeline.author: ajlopezrsk
ajlopezrsk

replies.bodyText: We wanted to keep consistency with the behaviour of "callToAddress()", which handles all the errors internally, it doesn't bubble up the error but push a Zero into the stack.
replies.author: patogallaiovlabs

timeline.author: ajlopezrsk

replies.bodyText: Idem as before. No need of handling here, it's made internally.
replies.author: patogallaiovlabs

timeline.message: fix sonarcloud codesmells
Rename PrecompiledContractException -> VMException. Remove handling of RuntimeException, only VMException handler. Replace throwing of Runtime by VMException in precompiled.

replies.bodyText: Was just for sonar not complaining... but I will change them to smthg with more sense.

timeline.bodyText: this if should always be true at this point, right?
timeline.author: fedejinich

replies.bodyText: Theoretically you could have a regtest where it is false, but that doesn't make much sense really.
replies.author: donequis

timeline.message: Small refactor. Remove old RSKIP checks from new code

timeline.bodyText: Why not add the try catch internally in ensureBtcBlockStore?
timeline.author: josedahlquist

replies.bodyText: Not sure if catching inside, could break the behaviour of other methods like "getBtcTransactionConfirmationsGetCost". So, I thought that the safest way was this one, apart from out of scope. Let me know your thoughts.
replies.author: patogallaiovlabs
